title: Harrold Odell Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Nigel Homer / Harrold Odell Country Park
images.caption: Birds on the pond in September 2005

images.title: Nigel Stickells / Island in Harrold Odell Country Park
images.caption: Island in Harrold Odell Country Park. The Island in the middle of the pond offers a retreat to the large numbers of waterbirds that live and feed in and around the several ponds in the park.

images.title: Nigel Stickells / Footpath & Bridge in Harrold Odell Country Park
images.caption: Footpath & Bridge in the park. There is a public footpath all the way around the principal pond within the Country Park which is a highly popular spot for walkers and for recreational use. This bridge takes the footpath over a lateral drainage ditch on the north-western side of the park.

images.title: Nigel Stickells / North-western Shoreline in Harrold Odell Country Park
images.caption: North-western Shoreline. The pond within the Harrold Odell Country Park was created out of old gravel extraction workings which occur throughout the Great Ouse valley. This view shows the north-western shoreline within this square.

images.title: The War Memorial and the Market Place, Harrold by Cameraman, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The War Memorial and the Market Place, Harrold. A nice view of the village of Harold which lies just to the west of the park. The small village is a pleasant place for a stroll after visiting the park. An ancient bridge links the village with Carlton with Chellington on the south bank of the River Great Ouse.

images.title: Footbridge over River Great Ouse at Odell by PAUL FARMER, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footbridge over River Great Ouse at Odell. You can enjoy a walk past the River Great Ouse to the village of Odell on the eastern side of the park.

description: This park has two pretty lakes set in 144 acres of country park. It is located between Bedford and Northampton on the River Great Ouse near the villages of Harrold and Odell in Bedfordshire.  You will find river meadows, a nature reserve, two picturesque lakes and a range of managed habitats. There is also free parking and refreshments in the Tea-Zels Cafe. There are a number of well maintained walking paths around the lakes and through the nature reserve while cycling is permitted along the lakeside bridleway. The North Bedfordshire Heritage Trail also runs through the park so there is scope for continuing your walk if you have time. You could follow the trail east to visit nearby Felmersham and Sharnbrook where you'll find pleasant riverside trails, a Norman church, a wildlife rich local nature reserve and a delightful mill theatre converted from the historic old water mill.
